intro: Cyathocalyx olivaceus, commonly known as the olive-leaved cyathocalyx, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive olive-green leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish-white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
